meanings.definition: A circular band worn as an ornament or a token of marriage.
meanings.sent1: She proudly displayed her new diamond ring.
meanings.sent2: The wedding ring symbolizes their commitment to each other.
meanings.sent3: He pretended to propose with a candy ring as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The ring of gold on her finger shone brightly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The ring sparkled like a tiny galaxy on her hand.

meanings.definition: A resonant sound or series of sounds.
meanings.sent1: The bell's ring echoed through the church.
meanings.sent2: The phone's ring interrupted the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The joyful ring of laughter filled the room.
meanings.sent4: The ring of the wind chimes soothed her restless mind.
meanings.sent5: The ring of the alarm clock woke him up abruptly.

meanings.sent1: She used a rope to ring the tree for support.
meanings.sent2: The mountains ring the valley, creating a natural barrier.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to ring the mouse in a playful chase.
meanings.sent4: The city lights ringed the horizon in a beautiful glow.
meanings.sent5: The fence will ring the garden to keep out pests.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things arranged in a circle.
meanings.sent1: The children formed a ring around the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The circus performers danced in a colorful ring.
meanings.sent3: The birds flew in a perfect ring formation in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The audience formed a ring around the stage for the performance.
meanings.sent5: The knights stood in a protective ring around the king.

meanings.sent1: I will ring you as soon as I reach home.
meanings.sent2: She forgot to ring her friend on her birthday.
meanings.sent3: He decided to ring his parents to share the good news.
meanings.sent4: Don't forget to ring the office before your meeting.
meanings.sent5: She promised to ring her sister after work.
